Why most ICS 'experts' are wrong — and why it’s putting plants at riskMost Industrial Control Systems (ICS) fail not from unknown threats, but from false assumptions about outdated security models like Purdue that no longer match today's cloud-connected, multi-vendor industrial environments. Systems should be designed using "antiknowledge" expecting the unexpected and building for survival rather than trying to predict every possible failure.
